article:
This is a 'list of [[open-source]] [[bioinformatics]] software' with articles in
Wikipedia.

{| class="wikitable"
|-
! Software Description Resources Platform License Developer
|- .NET Bio A language-neutral bioinformatics toolkit built using the Microsoft
|4.0 .NET Framework to help developers, researchers, and scientists.
|[http://bio.codeplex.com/ Website] .NET Framework Apache License Collaborative
|project - Anduril Component-based workflow framework for data analysis
|[http://csbl.fimm.fi/anduril/ Website] Linux, Mac OS X, Windows GPL University
|of Helsinki - - Armadillo workflow platform Tool for designing and executing
|phylogenetic workflows [http://adn.bioinfo.uqam.ca/armadillo Website] Mac OS X,
|Windows General Public Licence (GPL) [http://adn.bioinfo.uqam.ca/armadillo
|Armadillo] - - AutoDock suite of automated docking tools
|[http://autodock.scripps.edu Website] Platform GNU GPL Developer - Biochemical
|Algorithms Library (BALL) C++ library and framework for molecular modeling and
|visualization designed for rapid prototyping [http://www.ball-project.org
|Website] â [http://www.biomedcentral.com/1471-2105/11/531 Articles] Linux, Mac
|OS X, Windows LGPL [http://www.ball-project.org/overview/team BALL project
|team] - Bio4j Bio4j is a bioinformatics platform and graph based database built
|around most data available in UniProt KB(Swiss-Prot + TrEMBL), Gene Ontology
|(GO), UniRef (50,90,100), RefSeq, NCBI taxonomy, and Expasy Enzyme DB
|[http://www.bio4j.com/ Website] Cross-platform GPL v3
|[http://www.ohnosequences.com/ Oh no sequences!] - Bioclipse Visual platform
|for chemo- and bioinformatics based on the Eclipse Rich Client Platform (RCP).
|[http://www.bioclipse.net/ Website] Platform Eclipse Public License The
|Bioclipse Project - Bioconductor R (programming language) language toolkit
|[http://www.bioconductor.org Website] â [http://genomebiology.com/2004/5/10/R80
|Articles] Linux, Mac OS X, Windows Artistic License 2.0 Fred Hutchinson Cancer
|Research Center - [http://sourceforge.net/projects/biotutorial/ Bioinformatics
|Learning Tutorial (BLT)] Educational interactive tutorials and 3D animations
|for Replication, Transcription, and Translation
|[http://sourceforge.net/projects/biotutorial/ Project Home] â
|[http://sourceforge.net/projects/biotutorial/files/latest/download Download for
|Windows] Windows (), Linux & Mac OS X (source code only with Qt libraries)
|Academic Free License Collaborative project - BioHaskell Haskell (programming
|language) [http://biohaskell.org/ Project web site] â
[http://hackage.haskell.org/packages/archive/pkg-list.html#cat:bioinformatics
Bioinformatics software in Haskell]
| Linux, Mac OS X, Windows GPL, LGPL, and BSD Collaborative project -
| BioJava Java (programming language) [http://biojava.org/wiki/Main_Page
| Website] Linux, Mac OS X, Windows LGPL v2.1 Open Bioinformatics Foundation
| - BioMOBY registry of web services [http://www.biomoby.org/ Website] â
| [http://bib.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/abstract/3/4/331 Articles] Web
| License Open Bioinformatics Foundation - BioPerl Perl language toolkit
| [http://www.bioperl.org Website] Cross-platform Artistic License & GPL
| Open Bioinformatics Foundation - BioPHP PHP language toolkit
| [http://genephp.sourceforge.net Website] Platform License Open
| Bioinformatics Foundation - Biopython Python language toolkit
| [http://biopython.org/ Website] Cross-platform
| [http://www.biopython.org/DIST/LICENSE Biopython License] Open
| Bioinformatics Foundation - BioRails a data management system designed to
| support researchers in drug discovery [http://biorails.org/ Website]
| Platform License Developer - BioRuby Ruby language toolkit
| [http://bioruby.org Website] Platform GNU GPL v2 or Ruby license Open
| Bioinformatics Foundation - BioSmalltalk Smalltalk language toolkit
| [http://code.google.com/p/biosmalltalk/ Website] Cross-platform MIT
| license Developer - BioUno BioUno is a project that applies Continuous
| Integration tools and techniques in Bioinformatics. It uses Jenkins and
| its plug-in API to create biology workflows and manage computer clusters.
| [http://biouno.org/ Website] Cross-platform MIT license
| [http://www.tupilabs.com TupiLabs] -
| [https://wiki.nci.nih.gov/display/caCORE/ caCORE] ontologic representation
| environment [https://cabig.nci.nih.gov/tools/concepts/caCORE_overview
| Website] â
| [http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/abstract/19/18/2404
| Articles] Platform License National Cancer Institute -
| [https://cabig.nci.nih.gov/tools/caArray caArray] ontologic representation
| environment [http://caarray.nci.nih.gov/documentation] â [https://cabig-
| kc.nci.nih.gov/Molecular/KC/index.php/CaArray] Platform License National
| Cancer Institute - EMBOSS Suite of packages for sequencing, searching,
| etc. [http://emboss.sourceforge.net Website] Platform General Public
| Licence (GPL) and Library GPL Collaborative project -
| [http://gaggle.systemsbiology.net Gaggle] A framework for interoperability
| between systems biology software [http://gaggle.systemsbiology.net/
| Website] â [http://www.biomedcentral.com/1471-2105/7/176 Paper] â [http://www.biomedcentral.com/1471-
| 2105/8/456 Firegoose paper] Linux, Mac OS X, Windows LGPL Institute for
| Systems Biology - Galaxy Scientific workflow and data integration system
| [http://galaxyproject.org/ Website] Unix-like
| [http://galaxyproject.org/wiki/Admin/License License] Penn State and Emory
| University - GenePattern Scientific workflow system that provides access
| to more than 150 genomic analysis tools [http://www.genepattern.org
| Website] Unix-like (public server); Linux, Mac OS X, Windows MIT license
| Broad Institute - GeWorkbench Genomic data integration platform
| [http://www.geworkbench.org Website] Linux, Mac OS X, Windows
| [http://wiki.c2b2.columbia.edu/workbench/index.php/GeWorkbench_License
| License] Columbia University - GMOD Toolkit for addressing many common
| challenges at biological databases. [http://gmod.org/ Website] Unix-like
| (server), Web browser (client) Varies depending on tool Collaborative
| project - GeneTalk Tool for filtering sequence variants in VCF files.
| Network for scientists and clinicians for expertise and knowledge
| exchange. Database of annotations aboute sequence variants with clinically
| relevant information. [http://www.gene-talk.de Website] Unix-like
| (server), Web browser (client), Mac OS X, Freemium CharitÃ© - GenGIS
| Application that allows users to combine digital map data with information
| about biological sequences collected from the environment.
| [http://kiwi.cs.dal.ca/GenGIS Website] Windows, Mac OS X GPL Collaborative
| project - GenomeSpace Centralized web application that provides data
| format transformations and facilitates connections with other
| bioinformatics tools [http://www.genomespace.org Website] Web browser LGPL
| Broad Institute, Collaborative project - GENtle An equivalent to the
| proprietary Vector NTI, a tool to analyze and edit DNA sequence files
| [http://gentle.magnusmanske.de/ Website] Platform GPL Magnus Manske -
| Integrated Genome Browser Java-based desktop genome browser
| [http://igb.bioviz.org Website] Linux, Mac OS X, Windows CPL 1.0
| [http://genoviz.sourceforge.net GenoViz] - Integrative Genomics Viewer
| (IGV) High-performance desktop tool for interactive visual exploration of
| diverse genomic data [http://www.broadinstitute.org/igv Website] Linux,
| Mac OS X, Windows LGPL Broad Institute - IntAct molecular interaction
| database [http://www.ebi.ac.uk/intact/ Website] â
| [http://nar.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/abstract/35/suppl_1/D561
| Articles] Platform License European Bioinformatics Institute - InterMine
| Extensive data warehouse system for the analysis and integration of
| biological datasets [http://www.intermine.org/ Website] Cross-platform
| LGPL University of Cambridge - Java Treeview microarray data viewer
| [http://jtreeview.sourceforge.net/ Website] â
| [http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/cgi/content/abstract/20/17/3246
| Articles] Cross-platform License Developer - LabKey Server platform for
| integrating, analyzing and sharing data [http://www.labkey.org/ Website]
| Linux, Mac OS X, Windows Apache License [http://www.labkey.org/ LabKey
| Software Foundation] - OpenClinica software for capturing and managing
| data in clinical trials [https://community.openclinica.com/ Website]
| Linux, Windows LGPL [https://www.openclinica.com/about OpenClinica] - [http://www.biomedcentral.com/1471-
| 2164/13/512 PromKappa] PromKappa (Promoter analysis by Kappa) software
| program used for promoter pattern generation and promoter analysis. [http://www.biomedcentral.com/content/supplementary/1471-2164-13-512-
| s3.rar Download here.] Windows Open access University of Bucharest -
| [http://www.tm4.org/mev/ MeV: Multi-Experiment Viewer] a desktop
| application for the analysis, visualization and data-mining of large-scale
| genomic data [http://www.tm4.org/mev/ website] Linux, Mac OS X, Windows
| Artistic License Dana-Farber Cancer Institute - REDCRAFT software for
| determining tertiary protein structure given assigned Residual Dipolar
| Coupling data [http://ifestos.cse.sc.edu/ Website] Linux, Mac OS X,
| Windows GPL v3 [http://ifestos.cse.sc.edu/software.php#redcraft REDCRAFT]
| - SAM Tools Data format (SAM) and accompanying tool suite, for storing
| large nucleotide sequence alignments [http://samtools.sourceforge.net/
| Website] Linux BSD, MIT License 1000 Genomes Project - Staden Package
| Sequence assembly, editing and analysis, primarily consisting of gap4,
| gap5 and spin. [http://staden.sourceforge.net/ Website] Linux, Mac OS X,
| Windows BSD Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute / Medical Research Council -
| STAMP Software package for analyzing metagenomic profiles that promotes
| âbest practicesâ in choosing appropriate statistical techniques and
| reporting results. [http://kiwi.cs.dal.ca/Software/STAMP Website] Windows,
| Mac OS X GPL Collaborative project - Taverna workbench Tool for designing
| and executing workflows [http://www.taverna.org.uk Website] Linux, Mac OS
| X, Windows LGPL myGrid - - - TGAC Browser Genome Browser, visualisation
| solutions for big data in the genomic era [http://tgac-browser.tgac.ac.uk/
| TGAC Browser Web Demo] [https://github.com/TGAC/TGACBrowser GitHub] Unix-
| like (server), Web browser (client) GPL V3 [http://www.tgac.ac.uk The
| Genome Analysis Centre (TGAC), UK] - - T-REX WebServer Bioinformatics and
| phylogenetics webserver (NJ, PhyML, RAxML, MAFFT, MUSCLE, Newick viewer,
| Horizontal gene transfer detection, Reticulograms, Substitution models)
| [http://www.trex.uqam.ca Website] Web platform Academic Free License
| [http://www.trex.uqam.ca/ T-REX] - - UGENE integrated bioinformatics tools
| [http://ugene.unipro.ru/ Website] â [http://youtube.com/uniprougene/
| Podcast] Linux, Mac OS X, Windows GPL2 License [http://ugene.unipro.ru/
| Unipro] - Visomics bioinformatics tools for omics data
| [http://www.visomics.org/ Website] Windows Apache 2.0 License
| [http://www.visomics.org/visomics/project/parti.html Collaborative
| Project] - }
